dlgPart.npc_text: Feng came to Teron with a caravan two decades ago. Nobody knew where he came from or why, but he had the bitterness of a man soured by the memory of the life he lost. He was well versed in languages and the antiquities, but the town already had a loremaster. Fortunately for Feng, the loremaster fell sick and passed away, despite the best efforts of the local alchemist who was quite puzzled by the symptoms. Feng became the new loremaster and even earned the favor of Lord Antidas after discovering several Daratan relics.

dlgAnsw.text: Talk to Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text: "Did you finish translating that scroll? Never mind, I have a better job for you. Someone at the inn has a trinket they want me to look at. Why don't you handle it? Just remember what I taught you: take a good look, show some excitement, then tell them that it's a very valuable artefact that's worth a lot to the right collector, and that they were right to bring it to us to learn its true value. Wait for the words to sink in and then ask for 100 imperials to research it further."

dlgAnsw.text: "What if it actually is a valuable artifact?"
"A trinket?"
"I will go there right away, Master."

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Artefacts? I've been stuck in this shithole you call a town for the last twenty years. Year after year, farmers and diggers bring me everything they find, hoping for a lucky break. They bring me bracelets, cheap pottery, rusty old locks, pipes, chamber pots, even deformed skulls.
"The sad truth is that this town doesn't have anything of value, which is probably the only reason why Antidas is still in charge."

dlgAnsw.text: "Why did you stay then?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Weren't you listening? Every year peasants bring me junk to appraise. Good business."

dlgAnsw.text: "You said he had a trinket?"
"I will go there right away, Master."

dlgPart.npc_text: "I think the word 'map' was mentioned. Go and take a look. If it's something good, bring it to me."

dlgAnsw.text: "What if it actually is a valuable artifact?"
"I will go there right away, Master."

dlgPart.npc_text:
The inn is full of guests. After spending weeks and sometimes months on the road, they have an unhealthy appetite for cheap wine, stove-cooked meals, and women willing to share their beds for a few coins.
You navigate through the busy crowd and go upstairs. The trader's room is easy to find. "Are you the loremaster I sent for?" asks Gracius, letting you in.

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm <charname>, Master Feng's apprentice. Should my master's attention be required, I'll send for him. Where is the artefact?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Right here." Gracius hands you the scroll.
You open the scroll carefully and study it for a few minutes. It looks like an ordinary map depicting a temple. There is an old seal at the bottom. The name on the seal is Thor-Agoth.

onLoadScripts.string: dlgAddTextBoxMessage("You receive the map from Gracius");

dlgAnsw.text: "It's a very valuable artefact that's worth a lot to the right collector. You were wise to bring it to us to learn its true value."

dlgPart.npc_text: "And what might this true value be?" Gracius tries to sound indifferent, but it's obvious that Feng's simple formula worked its magic.

dlgAnsw.text: "For someone who's interested in the High Lords' artefacts, it could be worth thousands. I'll have to study the map further, of course, to determine its history and value."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Please forgive this uneducated trader, <master/mistress> <charname>, but who are the High Lords? I will be presenting this map to Lord Antidas tomorrow, and I'd like to impress His Lordship with some bits of knowledge."

dlgAnsw.text: "According to the legends, the High Lords were our allies in the war between our glorious Empire and the ruthless Qantari. While their nature is debatable, most loremasters agree that it was definitely supernatural. This map bears the seal of Thor-Agoth or Toragoth, as he was also known."

dlgPart.npc_text: "And what is the significance of this seal?"

dlgAnsw.text: [lore failure][persuasion]"It's hard to say right now. That's why we need to do a proper research. I'm sure you'd want to be absolutely certain that the seal that makes the map so valuable isn't a fake. It might be very embarrassing for you otherwise. Unless, of course, you insist that..."

[lore success][persuasion]"Thor-Agoth's title was the Artificer. He built many machines, but most were destroyed during the war or lost after. There are many people who hope that some caches have survived and can be recovered. They collect and study Thor-Agoth's documents, looking for clues. That's why we want to be absolutely certain that the seal that makes the map so valuable isn't a fake. It might be very embarrassing for you otherwise. Unless, of course, you insist that..."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"It doesn't look like a fake to me..."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm sure it's the genuine article, but we want to be certain, do we not, master merchant?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "We do, we do. Please, take the map and study it properly."

dlgAnsw.text: "And the money? I'm sure you know what the standard fee is."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Do you take me for a fool? I'll pay when your research is completed."

dlgAnsw.text: "Very well." Return to master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text:
"We do, we do. Please, take the map and study it properly.
"There is something else I'd like you to look at. You seem very knowledgeable." He pauses and reaches inside his sash. "I found it where I found the map." He gives you a small object. It's a metal sphere with grooves on its surface.

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll study it with master Feng. Now, about the money... I'm sure you know what the standard fee is."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Do you take me for a fool? I'll pay when your research is completed."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll see you in the morning." Return to master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Of course not, <master/mistress>. Please, take the map and study it properly."

dlgAnsw.text: "And the money? I'm sure you know what the standard research fee is."

dlgPart.npc_text: Gracius gives you a small purse without any enthusiasm.

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll see you tomorrow, master Gracius." Return to master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text:
Gracius gives you a small purse without any enthusiasm. You're about to leave when you notice Gracius' hesitation.
"There is something else I'd like you to look at. You seem very knowledgeable." He pauses and reaches inside his sash. "I found it where I found the map." He gives you a small object. It's a metal sphere with grooves on its surface.

onLoadScripts.string: dlgAddTextBoxMessage("You got 100 imperials and a sphere from Gracius");

dlgAnsw.text: "I don't know what it is. I'm not even sure it's an artefact. I'll show it to master Feng and let you know what he thinks." Return to master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text: "How did it go?"

dlgAnsw.text: "It went well. I got a map, a sphere, and 100 imperials." Hand everything to Feng.
"It went well. I got a map and 100 imperials." Hand everything to Feng.
"I got the map but the trader refused to pay upfront." Hand the map to Feng.
"I got the map but the trader refused to pay upfront. I got this sphere, though." Hand the map and the sphere to Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text: "A map and a sphere! Oh, what a glorious day." Feng looks at the map. "The seal looks real. I'll take a better look tonight and let you know in the morning. As for the sphere, it's just a bead from some necklace." He counts 50 imperials and gives them to you, along with the sphere.

onLoadScripts.string: dlgAddTextBoxMessage("You receive the sphere and 50 imperials");

dlgAnsw.text: "Thank you, master." Rest for the night.

dlgPart.npc_text: "Well done." Feng looks at the map. "The seal looks real. I'll take a better look tonight and let you know in the morning." He counts 50 imperials and gives them to you.

dlgAnsw.text: "Thank you, master." Rest for the night.

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Refused to pay? What do you mean, refused to pay?" Feng sighs. "I try to teach you, but your skull is too thick. Nothing gets through..."
Feng looks at the map. "The seal looks real. I'll take a better look tonight and let you know in the morning."

dlgAnsw.text: Leave and rest for the night.

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Refused to pay? What do you mean, refused to pay?" Feng sighs. "I try to teach you, but your skull is too thick. Nothing gets through..."
Feng looks at the map. "The seal looks real. I'll take a better look tonight and let you know in the morning. As for the sphere, it's just a bead from some necklace." He throws it to you.

dlgAnsw.text: Leave and rest for the night.

dlgPart.npc_text: "The map is ordinary. No "X marks the spot" there. The seal is interesting and well preserved, but it's worth no more than a hundred imperials. Maybe Antidas will buy it. Go see him when you have a chance." He gives you the map.

dlgAnsw.text: "Buy it? What about the trader, Gracius?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Almost forgot. He's dead, so you can keep the map. Apparently, he wasn't welcome in this town, and with the assassins' guild almost out of work... I'm surprised he made it as far as the inn." Feng chuckles.

dlgAnsw.text: "Is there anything else you want me to do, master?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
Feng gives you an appraising look. "As a matter of fact... You see, <charname>, being a loremaster isn't just about dealing with rarities. Knowing how to deal with people is equally important. I believe I've neglected this part of your education, but fortunately, it should be easy to fix.
"Lord Antidas has invited another loremaster to Teron. Needless to say, I don't share his opinion that two heads are better than one, and I'll be very grateful if you can find a way to get rid of the new loremaster. You'll secure your future and learn a valuable lesson at the same time.
"His name is Cassius. He's probably at the inn already, so don't waste any time."

dlgAnsw.text: "Secure my future?"
"Are you asking me to kill him?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "You don't think the new loremaster would need your services and look after you the way I do, do you? Don't be foolish."

dlgAnsw.text: "Are you asking me to kill him?"
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Do I detect some qualms? You have so much to learn, <charname>. When you have a thorn in your side, do you not remove it? Ah, perhaps you think that a man isn't a thorn, that a man's life, unlike that of an insect, has some value? It doesn't.
"Truly, I should be charging you for these lessons. Take this dagger, <charname> and go. Prove that my faith in you wasn't misplaced."

dlgAnsw.text: "What did you mean with secure my future?"
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: END - Cassius quest taken 60 reward

You're about to leave, when the innkeeper stops you.
"Another, um, guest is in need of your services, <master/mistress>. He's a prospector. Would you be kind enough to take a look?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Sure."
"Not right now." Return to Master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text:
The innkeeper sends one of the slaves to get the prospector. It's a man with a sun-darkened skin, unkempt hair and a heavy beard. His faded, worn-out clothes are still covered with road dust. He opens his bag, takes out a dozen of carefully wrapped items of various sizes, and slowly removes the dirty rags protecting them.
You browse through his treasures: gears, pottery, half-burned scrolls with faded, no longer decipherable letters, glass jars with strange liquids. "Anything you want to buy?" asks the prospector anxiously. "I'm embarrassed to admit, but I find myself without sufficient funds to pay for a comfortable stay, although I'm sure that some of these artefacts are bound to fetch a high price. I mean, just look at this beauty," he picks up a rusted cylinder with a spiral groove. "The very definition of a mysterious device. From a wondrous artefact, no doubt! What do you think, loremaster?"

dlgAnsw.text: [lore]"It's called a worm and it's missing a gear that goes with it. It was a common device."
"It does look interesting. Perhaps, you'd like me to research it for you?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "How about you buy it and then research it all you like. Can be yours for a hundred imperials."

dlgAnsw.text: "It's not worth that much."

dlgPart.npc_text:
"It's not worth that much to *you*," counters the prospector. "Shows how much you know, if you ask me. Alright, I wanted to save it for later, but I do need to pay for the inn, so..." The prospector unwraps yet another 'artefact', revealing a charred skull.
"The skull of a Magi! The Power still burns through him, much like it did when he was alive, walking the earth and battling demons. When nights are dark, it glows softly, keeping the demons at bay."

dlgAnsw.text: [lore success]"It does have the magic, but it's dangerous and will kill you if you keep it. Stay away from anything that glows in the dark."
"Fascinating. Well, I better get going." Return to master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text:
The prospector sighs and unwraps yet another 'artefact', revealing a charred skull.
"The skull of a Magi! The Power still burns through him, much like it did when he was alive, walking the earth and battling demons. When nights are dark, it glows softly, keeping the demons at bay."

dlgAnsw.text: [lore success]"It does have the magic, but it's dangerous and will kill you if you keep it. Stay away from anything that glows in the dark."
"Fascinating. Well, I better get going." Return to master Feng.

dlgPart.npc_text: "Why?"

dlgAnsw.text: "The old magic is like fire. Fire can keep you warm, cook your food, and help you forge weapons and tools, but it can also burn down your house or a forest, the moment you lose control, which we don't have to begin with. Not anymore."

dlgPart.npc_text: "I have a special charm that keeps me safe." The prospector shows you a strange amulet, his face lit with eagerness and greed.

dlgAnsw.text: Take a look.

dlgPart.npc_text: You turn it over in your hands thoughtfully. Adorned with beads and engraved with runes, it appears to be a ceremonial bowl of some sort. Strangely warped, but that isn't unusual for artefacts of the Old Empire - who knows what arcane forces had been unleashed on it? Two small, metal drums are affixed to the underside, too awkwardly angled to be supports for the bowl. You rap one with a knuckle and listen. Hollow. Reservoirs, perhaps, containers of sacred liquid for the bowl? You are unsure, but you keep your expression carefully neutral, it wouldn't do for the punters to see your uncertainty. Unprofessional.

dlgAnsw.text: "How much do you want for it?"
[streetwise]"Junk. Worthless junk."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"Junk? The very fact that I'm standing here before you should attest to the quality of this charm."

dlgAnsw.text: "How much do you want for it?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Are you sure?" asks the prospector. "Do you know what it is?"

dlgAnsw.text: "No idea."
[streetwise]"It's a ceremonial bowl for burning incense."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"Are you sure?" asks the prospector again, this time with a lot of doubt in his voice. "You know what, I think I'll ask someone else."

dlgAnsw.text: "How much do you want for it?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Well, don't I feel foolish now... Still, the jewels alone have gotta be worth a few hundred. What do you think I can get for it?"

dlgAnsw.text: [trading]"I can get it off your hands for two hundred imperials."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"Three hundred and we have a deal. You won't regret it, I promise!"

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll think about it."

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Alright. Two hundred. Just for you."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll think about it."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Maybe I should ask someone else then."

dlgAnsw.text: "How much do you want for it?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Five hundred! And you should consider yourself lucky that I'm willing to sell it. The very fact that I'm standing here before you should attest to the quality of this charm."

dlgAnsw.text: [trading]"Nobody in this town will pay five hundred for it, so you can either starve to death or sell it to me for three hundred. And you should consider yourself lucky that I'm willing to buy it."

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Alright. Three hundred. Just for you."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll think about it."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"The jewels alone are worth at least three hundred. There is no way I'm letting it go for less than five hundred."

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll think about it."

dlgPart.npc_text: "You do have the money, don't you?" asks the innkeeper watching the exchange with interest. "The only reason I'm letting him stay on credit is because you promised to buy that junk. I better see some money soon or I'm kicking him out."

dlgAnsw.text: Return to master Feng.
